item.title: Storm Tracking and the ISS
item.description: When a hurricane is born deep in the tropics, it begins as a swirl, a twist of wind on a warm patch of the ocean. It is silent and invisible to us on the ground, but for the astronauts in space? It would be a sight to behold, and sometimes, a chance to act fast. Inception of a Storm Storms begin in the tropical oceans, where sea surface temperatures (SST) above 26.
